TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IToolboxService

Docs.summary: Provides methods and properties to manage and query the toolbox in the development environment.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService> interface provides properties and methods for adding and removing toolbox items and toolbox creator callback delegates, serializing and deserializing toolbox items, and retrieving toolbox state information and managing toolbox state.
You can retrieve information about the contents of the toolbox with the following methods:
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.CategoryNames%2A> property indicates the categories currently available on the toolbox.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SelectedCategory%2A> property indicates the currently selected toolbox category.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> method retrieves the items on the toolbox, optionally filtered by a specified toolbox category.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.GetSelectedToolboxItem%2A> method retrieves the currently selected <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SetSelectedToolboxItem%2A> method selects the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> as the current toolbox item.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.IsSupported%2A> method indicates whether the specified serialized object, if it is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, is supported by the specified designer host, or whether it matches the specified attributes.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.IsToolboxItem%2A> method indicates whether the specified serialized object is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
You can add and remove toolbox items with the following methods:
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddToolboxItem%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> to the toolbox, creating the optionally specified category if it does not exist.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddLinkedToolboxItem%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that is only enabled for the current project to the toolbox.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.RemoveToolboxItem%2A> method removes the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddCreator%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback> delegate capable of converting some type of data stored on the toolbox to a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.RemoveCreator%2A> method removes any <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback> delegates for the specified data type.
You can refresh the toolbox, mark a toolbox item as used, or set the mouse cursor to a cursor that represents the current toolbox item using the following methods:
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.Refresh%2A> method refreshes the toolbox display to reflect the current state of the toolbox items.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SelectedToolboxItemUsed%2A> method signals the toolbox that the selected toolbox item has been used.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SetCursor%2A> method sets the mouse cursor to a cursor that represents the current toolbox item.
You can use the toolbox to serialize or deserialize a toolbox item using the following methods:
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.DeserializeToolboxItem%2A> method attempts to return a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> from the specified serialized toolbox item object.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SerializeToolboxItem%2A> method returns a serialized object representing the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService> in design mode to list and select toolbox categories and items, and to create components or controls from toolbox items and add them to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. To use the example, compile the code to an assembly, and add a reference to the assembly in a Windows Forms application. If you are using Visual Studio, the `IToolboxServiceControl` is automatically added to the **Toolbox**. Create an instance of the `IToolboxServiceControl` on a form to test its behavior.
[!code-cpp[IToolboxServiceExample1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IToolboxServiceExample1/CPP/itoolboxservicecontrol.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[IToolboxServiceExample1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IToolboxServiceExample1/CS/itoolboxservicecontrol.cs#1)] [!code-vb[IToolboxServiceExample1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IToolboxServiceExample1/VB/itoolboxservicecontrol.vb#1)]
The following code example provides a component that uses the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService> to add a "Text" data format handler, or <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback>, to the toolbox. The data creator callback delegate passes any text data pasted to the toolbox and dragged onto a form to a custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> containing the text.
[!code-cpp[ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample/CPP/textdatatextboxcomponent.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample/CS/textdatatextboxcomponent.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample/VB/textdatatextboxcomponent.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Adds a new toolbox item creator for a specified data format.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddCreator (System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback creator, string format);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddCreator(class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback creator, string format) cil managed
Public Sub AddCreator (creator As ToolboxItemCreatorCallback, format As String)

Docs.param: A that can create a component when the toolbox item is invoked.
The data format that the creator handles.
Docs.summary: Adds a new toolbox item creator for a specified data format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A toolbox item creator can convert data of a particular data format that has been pasted or dropped on the toolbox into a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. If a creator handles more than one format, call <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddCreator%2A> more than once. Unexpected behavior may result if you add more than one creator for the same format.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddCreator (System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback creator, string format, System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost host);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddCreator(class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback creator, string format, class System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost host) cil managed
Public Sub AddCreator (creator As ToolboxItemCreatorCallback, format As String, host As IDesignerHost)
public: void AddCreator(System::Drawing::Design::ToolboxItemCreatorCallback ^ creator, System::String ^ format, System::ComponentModel::Design::IDesignerHost ^ host);

Docs.param: A that can create a component when the toolbox item is invoked.
The data format that the creator handles.
The that represents the designer host to associate with the creator.
Docs.summary: Adds a new toolbox item creator for a specified data format and designer host.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A toolbox item creator can convert data of a particular data format that has been pasted or dropped on the toolbox into a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. If a creator handles more than one format, call <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddCreator%2A> more than once. Unexpected behavior may result if you add more than one creator for the same format.
If the `host` parameter is set to `null`, the creator will be available to all designers. If a designer host is supplied, the creator will only be available to designers using the specified host.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Refresh() cil managed

Docs.summary: Refreshes the state of the toolbox items.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.Refresh%2A> method is used to indicate to the toolbox service that the user wants to update the cache of toolbox items. If the toolbox service maintains a live list of toolbox item containers, then this method will do nothing. If it maintains a snapshot of toolbox item containers, calling this method should ensure that the snapshot is up to date.
